result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven James Wurtz was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $600.00 plus all mandatory costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from up  to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by the end of Extended Supervision period.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after serving six (6) months of this sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy, and taking any prescribed medications.

No alcohol or controlled substances.
No new violations of law rising to probable cause.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.5

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven James Wurtz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven James Wurtz in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Steven James Wurtz in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

On motion of the state, pursuant to plea negotiations, COurt ordered COUNTS 2 and 3 DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY:
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  No voting until civil rights are restored.

  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for zero days.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 6 months of this sentence.

-Court ordered a fine in the amount of $600.00 PLUS all mandatory costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by the end of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by the end of extended supervision period; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Cooperate with agent
-No new violations of law rising to probable cause
-Court ordered the defendants driving privileges reviked for a period of 36 months
-Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 24 months
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Steven James Wurtz in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Steven James Wurtz in custody.  
Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case assigned to Branch 22 in error.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.
Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven James Wurtz in court with attorney Jeffry R Schwartz.  
Defendant Steven James Wurtz in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
